snippet: Jan Ullrich of Germany, who won the 1997 Tour de France but has since retired from cycling, was suspended for two years on Thursday in a largely symbolic move.
abstract: German cyclist Jan Ullrich, who won the 1997 Tour de France but has since retired from cycling, is suspended for two years by the Court of Arbitration for Sport for blood doping; because Ullrich is retired, move is largely symbolic.
lead_paragraph: Jan Ullrich of Germany, who won the 1997 Tour de France but has since retired from cycling, was suspended for two years on Thursday in a largely symbolic move.

headline.seo: Cyclist Jan Ullrich Penalized for Blood Doping
headline.main: Another Tour de France Winner Is Penalized for Doping
headline.print_headline: Another Tour de France Winner Is Penalized for Doping
